paragraphs: On Monday afternoon, September 8th, three young workers felt unwell on Opletalova Street near Wenceslas Square in the center of Prague. Two of them lost consciousness while carrying out excavation work.
The arriving medics brought patients born in 2001, 2004, and 2007 to the hospital. All three of them were experiencing a loss of consciousness and seizures.
Firefighters and police also arrived at the scene, as initially there were suspicions of a gas leak, which could have been inhaled by the workers.
However, the firefighters quickly ruled out this version - they conducted measurements and visually inspected the gas pipeline, finding no leaks.
According to police representative Jan Danek, everything indicates that the men felt unwell as a result of intoxication with a narcotic substance. The exact type is currently being determined.
